title: Francis Tualau
text:
Francis Tualau (born 23 May 1994) is a Tongan professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who last played as a for the <a href="Canterbury-Bankstown%20Bulldogs">Canterbury-Bankstown Bulldogs</a> in the <a href="National%20Rugby%20League">NRL</a>.
Background.
Tualau was born in <a href="Tofua">Tofua</a>, <a href="Tonga">Tonga</a>.
He played his junior rugby league for the <a href="Mangere%20East%20Hawks">Mangere East Hawks</a> in New Zealand, and <a href="South%20Eastern%20Titans">South Eastern Titans</a> in <a href="Victoria%20%28Australia%29">Victoria, Australia</a>, before being signed by the <a href="Melbourne%20Storm">Melbourne Storm</a>.
Playing career.
Early career.
In 2013 and 2014, Tualau played for the Melbourne Storm's <a href="National%20Youth%20Competition%20%28rugby%20league%29">NYC</a> team, before graduating to their <a href="Queensland%20Cup">Queensland Cup</a> team, <a href="Eastern%20Suburbs%20Tigers">Eastern Suburbs Tigers</a> in 2015. In October 2016, he signed a 3-year contract with the <a href="Canterbury-Bankstown%20Bulldogs">Canterbury-Bankstown Bulldogs</a> until the end of 2019.
2017.
In round 12 of the <a href="2017%20NRL%20season">2017 NRL season</a>, Tualau made his <a href="National%20Rugby%20League">NRL</a> debut for the Bulldogs against the <a href="Cronulla-Sutherland%20Sharks">Cronulla-Sutherland Sharks</a>.
